alert.note: Alert for Duval; Nassau; St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Florida, including the following counties, Duval, Nassau and St. Johns. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 444 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to heavy showers. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, Fernandina Beach, Ponte Vedra Beach, Jacksonville Beach, Atlantic Beach, Neptune Beach, World Golf Village, Palm Valley, Sawgrass, San Pablo, Nocatee, Durbin, Mayport, Fort Caroline, Little Talbot Island, Talbot Island, Amelia City and Bakersville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
